WORKING TO CONSERVE AT LEAST 30  EACH OF OUR LANDS AND WATERS BY THE YEAR 2030  WE WILL WORK TO PROTECT BIODIVERSITY, SLOW EXTINCTION RATES AND HELP LEVERAGE NATURAL CLIMATE SOLUTIONS BY CONSERVING 30  OF AMERICA S LANDS AND WATERS BY 2030  THIS RELIES ON SUPPORT FOR LOCAL, STATE, PRIVATE, AND TRIBALLY LED NATURE CONSERVATION AND RESTORATION EFFORTS THAT ARE UNDERWAY ACROSS AMERICA THROUGH EFFECTIVE MANAGEMENT OF THE GRAZING PERMITS AND THE RANGE PROGRAM, THERE IS OPPORTUNITY TO IMPROVE ECOLOGICAL CONDITIONS THROUGHOUT BLM NEVADA  THIS POSITION ASSISTS IN ASSURING THAT ALL NV RANGE STAFF AND MANAGERS CAN PROVIDE THE BEST RANGE PROGRAM OVERSIGHT POSSIBLE TO MAKE PUBLIC LANDS GRAZING AN ECOLOGICALLY SUSTAINABLE PRACTICE CREATE TRAINING MATERIAL FOR A VARIETY OF TOPICS, INCLUDING UNDERSTANDING AND MANAGING WORKLOAD PLANNING, CREATING AND MANAGING A MONITORING SCHEDULE, UNDERSTANDING WORKLOAD MEASURES, MONITORING, ETC  TRAIN AND MENTOR EXISTING STAFF AND MANAGERS, AS WELL AS CONTRIBUTING TO THE DEVELOPMENT OF AN ONBOARDING TRAINING FOR NEW RANGE STAFF AND MANAGERS  MENTOR EXISTING RANGE STAFF IN THE LAWS AND POLICIES OF THE BUREAU S RANGE PROGRAM AND ASSIST STAFF WITH PROPER RANGELAND DATA COLLECTION AND MONITORING TECHNIQUES  ALSO, BE A RESOURCE FOR DISTRICT AND FIELD MANAGERS FOR ANY QUESTIONS RELATED TO THE RANGE PROGRAM IN CLOSE COORDINATION WITH THE SO RANGE PROGRAM LEAD  DEVELOP AND CONDUCT TRAINING ON ALL ASPECTS OF THE RANGE PRIORITY WORKLOAD, ESPECIALLY ALL COMPONENTS INVOLVED IN PLANNING, MANAGING AND IMPLEMENTING THE COMPONENTS OF PERMIT RENEWAL AND IMPLEMENTATION DEVELOPMENT OF TRAINING MATERIAL DESIGNED FOR IMPROVING UNDERSTANDING OF THE RANGE PROGRAM, SPECIFICALLY THE MANAGEMENT AND IMPLEMENTATION OF ALL COMPONENTS INVOLVED IN THE PRIORITY WORKLOAD  ESPECIALLY PERMIT RENEWALS AND IMPLEMENTATION

THIS POSITION WILL SUPPORT BUREAU OF LAND MANAGEMENT PARIA RIVER DISTRICT (BLM PRD) IN ITS EFFORTS TO RESPOND AND COMPLY WITH PROCLAMATION 10286. THIS PROCLAMATION RESTORED THE BOUNDARIES OF THE GRAND STAIRCASE-ESCALANTE NATIONAL MONUMENT (GESNM) TO INCLUDE MORE THAN 800,000 ACRES OF LAND AND IDENTIFIED A NUMBER OF MONUMENT OBJECTS FOR PROTECTION, THUS PRIORITIZING RESOURCE MANAGEMENT PLANNING FOR THE RESTORED GSENM OVER ALL OTHER PLANNING WITHIN THE BLM PRD.WORK SUPPORTING BLM'S NEED TO MEET RECREATION AND VISITOR SERVICE NEEDS RESULTING FROM INCREASED VISITATION AND AREA GROWTH, INCLUDING OVERALL OVERSIGHT/MANAGEMENT OF NUMEROUS PROJECTS MAINLY NATIONAL ENVIRONMENTAL POLICY ACT (NEPA) PROCESS FOR PROJECTS.NEPA/PLANNING FOR HIGH PRIORITY/BACKLOGGED PROJECTS INCLUDES PLANNING, LEADING, AND COORDINATING THE DEVELOPMENT OF THE DOCUMENTS FROM PROJECT INITIATION TO DECISION (WRITING, REVIEWING, CATEGORICAL EXCLUSIONS, DETERMINATION OF NEPA ADEQUACY, ENVIRONMENTAL ASSESSMENTS, FINDING OF NO SIGNIFICANT IMPACTS, AND DECISION RECORDS)1. NEPA FOR RECREATION DEVELOPMENTS AND FACILITIES: DEVELOPMENT OF A LARGE SCALE PROGRAMMATIC ENVIRONMENTAL ASSESSMENT FOR THE PRD THAT WOULD ADDRESS A BACKLOG OF RECREATION FACILITIES AND DEVELOPMENTS SUCH AS, TRAIL HEADS, PARKING AREAS, AND BATHROOMS- THIS WOULD ALSO PROVIDE A DOCUMENT THAT CAN BE USED TO TIER FROM FOR FUTURE NEEDS FOR FACILITIES AND DEVELOPMENTS.2. NEPA FOR REALITY ACTIONS: DEVELOPMENT OF NEPA DOCUMENTS IN RESPONSE TO ROW APPLICATIONS/AMENDMENTS, MOSTLY FOR TITLE V ROWS AND ROAD IMPROVEMENTS/UPGRADES. ADDITIONALLY, BLM UTAH RECEIVED FUNDS FOR THE COTTONWOOD CREEK LAND ACQUISITION, THIS WILL BE A UTAH STATE OFFICE PRIORITY AND WILL REQUIRE NEPA.

EXPERIENCED SERVICES PROGRAM - PROVIDES PROGRAM LEADERSHIP, GUIDANCE, AND SCIENTIFIC/TECHNICAL DIRECTION FOR THE SEED ORCHARD PROGRAM IN OREGON AND WASHINGTON IN THE FOLLOWING AREAS OF MAJOR DUTIES:MENTOR PARTNERSHIPS AND ORCHARD AGREEMENT: TRAINING - ASSISTS ON A VARIETY OF COOPERATIVE AGREEMENTS AND MEMORANDUM OF UNDERSTANDING'S;OVERALL SEED ORCHARD PROGRAM MANAGEMENT:MENTORSHIP - PROVIDES PROGRAM LEADERSHIP, GUIDANCE, AND SCIENTIFIC/TECHNICAL TRAINING IN OREGON AND WASHINGTON. - MENTORS, COACHES THE NEW ORCHARDIST GS-11 INCUMBENT ON SEASONALLY TIME SENSITIVE OPERATIONAL EVENTS AND BUSINESS AGREEMENTS, MEETINGS, INVOICING, AND BUDGET. - COORDINATION OF RESOURCES, NEW ORCHARD DEVELOPMENT PLANNING, ORCHARD ESTABLISHMENT AND MAINTENANCE;LIAISON AND ADVISORY WORK: - MENTORS THE NATIONAL ENVIRONMENTAL POLICY ACT COORDINATION. - ACTS AS CONSULTANT AND ADVISOR TO THE ORCHARDS;LONG-TERM AND SHORT-TERM PLANNING: - REVIEWS/EDITS LONG-TERM STRATEGIC ORCHARD BUSINESS PLAN - MENTORS OTHERS ON THE DEVELOPMENT, IMPLEMENTATION, AND MAINTENANCE OF SHORT AND LONG-RANGE SEED ORCHARD FUNCTIONAL PLANS; ANDBUDGET AND PROCUREMENT:TRAINING- ADVISES ON TIMING AND TRAINS OTHERS ON THE BUDGET FORMULATION.

THIS PROJECT WILL CONSERVE BLM MANAGED LANDS BY PROVIDING A MEANS TO REMOVE TRASH AND HAZARDOUS MATERIALSFROM PUBLIC LANDS. THE FOCUS OF THIS PROJECT IS TO HIRE A TERM PROJECT MANAGER TO SPEARHEAD A CONCERTED,MULTI-YEAR CAMPAIGN IMPROVING ON THE DISTRICT AND STATE'S CURRENT EFFORTS TO END DUMPING. THE EXPECTATION IS THATTHIS FOCUSED EFFORT WILL RESULT IN A MORE EFFECTIVE REDUCTION OF ILLEGAL DUMPING AND DISPOSAL OF HAZARDOUS MATERIAL.

THIS PROJECT POSITION HELPS ENSURE THAT THE DEVELOPMENT OF COAL RESOURCES, LOCATABLE MINERALS, AND MINERALMATERIALS IS DONE RESPONSIBLY. THE ENROLLEE WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR CONDUCTING QUARTERLY AND ANNUAL COAL MINE INSPECTIONS, PRODUCTIONVERIFICATIONS, AND SUBMITTING REPORTS. THEY MAY ALSO BE RESPONSIBLE FOR THE FOLLOWING: 1. PARTICIPATING IN LEASE READJUSTMENTS, ROYALTY RATE REDUCTIONS, BOND REVIEWS, PERMITTING REVIEWS, AND LOGICALMINING UNIT MODIFICATIONS, 2. SUPPORTING THE ABANDONED MINE LANDS PROGRAM AND THE PALEONTOLOGY PROGRAM,
